answers.answer: I did.  This one will be my third c section.  Don't stress about it.  My first was because my son was breach.  Second was repeat,  and third is too.  I didn't feel anything other then movement while it was happening.

Yeah ended up with c section with my first, he was too big all around to come out naturally. Dont sweat it, its not as bad as u think... Just think ull know when she is coming and dont have to f up ur vagina lol
Thanks Ladies... its just scary to think that if I end up pregnant in the future I will have to have a repeat c section.. but if its for my baby's own good I will not think it twice.

I had a csection with my first because he was head up and got stuck on my pelvic bone. I had a successful VBAC with my second and hopefully will have another one with our third. Unless your hosptial will not allow VBAC's then you should have no problem.

I had an emergency c section with my first due to preeclampsia at 35weeks. For me anyway it was a breeze. I healed very fast afterwards. Im attempting a vbac with this pregnancy but if i end up with another c section Im fine with that as well.
I had to have a c-section with my first after almost 60 hours of being monitored in the hospital. I wouldn't dialate past 3cm and my baby ended up going into distress.

I had a emergency c section with my first born. His heart rate dropped after 10 hours of labor. The best way to describe it is no pain you just feel someone pull and tug at you. A little uncomfortable that's all
I had a c section with my first born he was to big to push out.. he weighed 9.4 lbs it wasn't so bad ..
I'm glad all u ladies had a speedy recovery... hopefully I will have one as well if  I have no other option other than a c section...thanks ladies

I will be having my second csection next month. but after 28 hrs of labor with my first and indiced 3 times i only dialted to 2cm then her heart rate dropped cause the cord was trying to come out before her head and everytime she pushed down she lost oxygen. buy i recovered and healed quickly. not as scary as it sounds.

Ended up having a c-section with my first because was failing to progress & after 19 hours of contractions,  baby was getting stressed! It is nothing to be scared of, my hubby watched the whole thing! I have a choice now with my 2nd whether to have a section again or vbac, still undecided?!

I had a csection with my first. Vbac with my 2nd. My daughter was 8lb13oz and 21inches long. I labored for hours and she just got stuck. I learned later there were things the hospital could have done to help that,but didn't do. I was heartbroken. I didnt want the c section at all. I was very forceful with my decision to have that VBAC the 2nd time. I am SO glad I did. People are under the impression that c sections are easier.  Which is a load of crap. Plainly put.... As women, our bodies are designed for birth.  As human beings were not meant to be sliced open! (Obviously in emergencies thats different) the recovery for my cesarean was long and painful. The natural birth I was messed up for like...a week ...maybe. if that!Have them let you try to push the baby out. My baby that I pushed out after my c section was even bigger and longer than the one I "needed" a csection with.He was 9lbs 5oz and 22 1\2 inches long.Im 10weeks with number 3 and hoping for another natural birth!I believe in you!Feel free to message me and ask me any questions!

Thanks again for sharing your stories ladies... that's what I don't understand my baby on weights 6 pounds 13 oz so they say... but there telling me she's measuring at 35 weeks which is slightly smaller now that I'm 38 wks 3 days as of today.. the only thing measuring bigger is her shoulders/ chest/ tummy which measures right on the 38 wks . .today I will be having another  ultradould

Today I will be having another ultrasound with a high risk MD to get a second opinion...I'm staying positive everything will be fine. It just scared me when my OB said baby might get stuck and her collar bone might brake if we try to get her out since she's measuring bigger..or even oxygen might not go to her brain... it freaked me out when she said that.. I'll keep u guys updated.

There is pain involved.. pretty much the first couple days.... it's uncomfortable but the pain meds help.. after a week you kinda start feeling normal again...but you gotta take it easy still.. I'm 33 weeks pregnant with my second.. and the best thing about having a planned c -section is exactly that it is planned and very calm unless you go into as not before lol
My friends doctor told her the same about her son and his collarbone did break.. second pregnancy she had a planned c-section..goodluck to u and ur baby...

question: Any of you mommies had to have a c section with your first born?  Im a FTM and might end up with a c section due to my baby measuring bigger from chest/ tummy than the rest of her body. Please share your story and the reason why the c section was nessesary?Thanks
title: C SECTION ?
